fast3d.util.math

Class RelationshipAnalytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.util.math.RelationshipAnalytics

  • public abstract class RelationshipAnalytics
extends java.lang.Object
    this class offers some static functionalities to analyze the relationship between points, straights and plates mathematically

    sometimes (if rational) a method is available with overloading to a parameter zeroLockControl:
    if the straights or plates may be intersecting; due to rounding errors of the computer the intersection may not be detected properly so it might be helpful to consider a slight rounding-mistake (0.0...01 may do)
    if the given value zeroLockControl is lower or equal 0 no mistake is considered and the check of intersection will be done on double == double

    Author:
    Tim Trense

      a wrapper to analyze(a,b,0.0); with zeroLockControl disabled
      static Relationship analyze(Plate a, Plate b, double zeroLockControl)
      compares the plates
      if ... the result will be ...: the plates are equal : IDENTICAL the plates are real-parallel : PARALLEL the first plate intersects the second plate (or vice versa) : INTERSECTING
      static Relationship analyze(Plate a, Point b)
      a wrapper to analyze(a,b,0.0); with zeroLockControl disabled
      static Relationship analyze(Plate plate, Point point, double zeroLockControl)
      compares the position of the point to the plate
      if the point is on the plate result will be intersecting otherwise parallel
      static Relationship analyze(Plate a, Straight b)
      a wrapper to analyze(a,b,0.0); with zeroLockControl disabled
      static Relationship analyze(Plate plate, Straight straight, double zeroLockControl)
      compares the straight and plate
      if ... the result will be ...: the plate contains the straight : INCIDENT the straight is real-parallel to the plate : PARALLEL the straight intersects the plate : INTERSECTING
      static Relationship analyze(Point a, Point b)
      compares the position of the points
      if they are equal result will be identical otherwise parallel
      static Relationship analyze(Straight straight, Point point)
      compares the position of the point to the straight
      if the point is on the straight result will be intersecting otherwise parallel
      static Relationship analyze(Straight a, Straight b)
      a wrapper to analyze(a,b,0.0); with zeroLockControl disabled
      static Relationship analyze(Straight a, Straight b, double zeroLockControl)
      compares the two straights a and b
      if they are ... result will be ...: askew : ASKEW identical : IDENTICAL real-parallel : PARALLEL intersecting : INTERSECTING
      static Relationship analyzeGeneral(GeometricObject a, GeometricObject b)
      a wrapper to analyze(GeometricalObject,GeometricalObject,0.0) with zeroLockControl disabled
      static Relationship analyzeGeneral(GeometricObject a, GeometricObject b, double zeroLockControl)
      a wrapper around all other analyze methods casting automatically points, straights and triangles/plates
      static double computeDistance(Plate a, Plate b)
      for a plate PARALLEL to the other plate the distance between the plates is greater than 0 otherwise 0
      the distance between two plates is the distance between the nadir point of any point on the first plate to the other plate
      static double computeDistance(Plate a, Point b)
      for a point non-INCIDENT to the plate the distance between the point and the plate is greater than 0 otherwise 0
      the distance between a point and a plate is the distance between the point and its nadir point on the plate
      static double computeDistance(Plate a, Straight b)
      for a straight PARALLEL to the plate the distance between the straight and the plate is greater than 0 otherwise 0
      the distance between a straight and a plate is the distance between the nadir point of any point on the straight to the plate
      static double computeDistance(Point a, Point b)
      for two non-IDENTICAL points their distance between them is greater than 0, otherwise 0
      static double computeDistance(Straight a, Point b)
      for a point non-INCIDENT to the straight the distance between the point and the straight is greater than 0 otherwise 0
      the distance between a point and a straight is the distance between the point and its nadir point on the straight
      static double computeDistance(Straight a, Straight b)
      a wrapper to computeDistance(Straight,Straight,double) with zeroLockControl disabled
      first their relationship is computed then this method calls the wrapped method
      static double computeDistance(Straight a, Straight b, double zeroLockControl)
      a wrapper to computeDistance(Straight,Straight,Relationship)
      first their relationship is computed then this method calls the wrapped method
      static double computeDistance(Straight a, Straight b, Relationship r)
      if the straights are PARALLEL: their distance is defined as the distance from any point on one of the straights to the other straight
      if the straights are ASKEW: their distance is the minimum distance between a pair of two points (one on the first straight and one on the other)
      in any other case the distance between the straights is undefined (result -1);
      static Straight computeIntersection(Plate a, Plate b)
      a wrapper to computeIntersection(Plate,Plate,double) with zeroLockControl disabled
      static Straight computeIntersection(Plate a, Plate b, double zeroLockControl)
      for INTERSECTING plates this method computes the straight that is INCIDENT for both plates
      static Point computeIntersection(Plate plate, Straight straight)
      for a straight INTERSECTING the plate this method computes the point that is on both the straight and the plate
      static Point computeIntersection(Straight a, Straight b)
      for INTERSECTING straights this method computes the point that is on both straights
      static GeometricObject findCorrespond(Renderable r)
      for a given renderable that is instance either of the following the result will be the geometric object that contains the renderable as a subset of points Pixel to Point Line to Straight Triangle or Rectangle to Plate

      • analyze

        public static Relationship analyze(Point a,
                                   Point b)
        compares the position of the points
        if they are equal result will be identical otherwise parallel
        Parameters:
        a - the point to check against the other
        b - the point to be checked against the other
        Returns:
        whether the points have the same location (IDENTICAL) or nor (PARALLEL)

      • analyze

        public static Relationship analyze(Straight straight,
                                   Point point)
        compares the position of the point to the straight
        if the point is on the straight result will be intersecting otherwise parallel
        Parameters:
        straight - the straight to check whether it contains the point mathematically
        point - the point to be checked whether it is on the straight
        Returns:
        whether the point is element of the straight (INCIDENT) or not (PARALLEL)

      • analyze

        public static Relationship analyze(Plate plate,
                                   Point point,
                                   double zeroLockControl)
        compares the position of the point to the plate
        if the point is on the plate result will be intersecting otherwise parallel
        Parameters:
        plate - the mathematical plate to check whether it contains the point
        point - the point to be checked whether it is in the plate
        zeroLockControl - see documentation for this class
        Returns:
        whether the point is element of the plate (INCIDENT) or not (PARALLEL)

      • analyze

        public static Relationship analyze(Straight a,
                                   Straight b,
                                   double zeroLockControl)
        compares the two straights a and b
        if they are ... result will be ...:
        • askew : ASKEW
        • identical : IDENTICAL
        • real-parallel : PARALLEL
        • intersecting : INTERSECTING
        Parameters:
        a - one straight to check against the other
        b - the other straight to check against the first
        zeroLockControl - see documentation for this class
        Returns:
        the relationship of the two straights

      • analyze

        public static Relationship analyze(Plate plate,
                                   Straight straight,
                                   double zeroLockControl)
        compares the straight and plate
        if ... the result will be ...:
        • the plate contains the straight : INCIDENT
        • the straight is real-parallel to the plate : PARALLEL
        • the straight intersects the plate : INTERSECTING
        Parameters:
        plate - the plate to check against the straight
        straight - the straight to be checked against the plate
        zeroLockControl - see documentation for this class
        Returns:
        the relationship between the straight and plate

      • analyze

        public static Relationship analyze(Plate a,
                                   Plate b,
                                   double zeroLockControl)
        compares the plates
        if ... the result will be ...:
        • the plates are equal : IDENTICAL
        • the plates are real-parallel : PARALLEL
        • the first plate intersects the second plate (or vice versa) : INTERSECTING
        Parameters:
        a - the plate to check against the other
        b - the other plate to be checked against the first
        zeroLockControl - see documentation for this class
        Returns:
        the relationship between the plates

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • computeDistance

        public static double computeDistance(Straight a,
                                     Point b)
        for a point non-INCIDENT to the straight the distance between the point and the straight is greater than 0 otherwise 0
        the distance between a point and a straight is the distance between the point and its nadir point on the straight
        Parameters:
        a - the straight
        b - the point
        Returns:
        the minimal distance from the point to a point (in particular the nadir point) on the straight

        b - the point
        Returns:

        b - the straight

      • computeDistance

        public static double computeDistance(Plate a,
                                     Plate b)
        for a plate PARALLEL to the other plate the distance between the plates is greater than 0 otherwise 0
        the distance between two plates is the distance between the nadir point of any point on the first plate to the other plate
        Parameters:
        a - one plate
        b - another plate
        Returns:
        the minimal distance from any point on the first plate to a point (in particular the nadir point) on the other plate

      • computeDistance

        public static double computeDistance(Straight a,
                                     Straight b,
                                     Relationship r)
        if the straights are PARALLEL: their distance is defined as the distance from any point on one of the straights to the other straight
        if the straights are ASKEW: their distance is the minimum distance between a pair of two points (one on the first straight and one on the other)
        in any other case the distance between the straights is undefined (result -1);
        Parameters:
        a - one straight
        b - another straight
        r - their relationship
        Returns:
        the minimal distance between them if they are PARALLEL or ASKEW, -1 otherwise

      • computeDistance

        public static double computeDistance(Straight a,
                                     Straight b,
                                     double zeroLockControl)
        a wrapper to computeDistance(Straight,Straight,Relationship)
        first their relationship is computed then this method calls the wrapped method
        Parameters:
        a - one straight
        b - another straight
        zeroLockControl - the zeroLockControl for analyze
        Returns:
        the minimal distance between them if they are PARALLEL or ASKEW, -1 otherwise
        See Also:
        computeDistance(Straight, Straight, Relationship), analyze(Straight, Straight, double)

      • computeDistance

        public static double computeDistance(Straight a,
                                     Straight b)
        a wrapper to computeDistance(Straight,Straight,double) with zeroLockControl disabled
        first their relationship is computed then this method calls the wrapped method
        Parameters:
        a - one straight
        b - another straight
        Returns:
        the minimal distance between them if they are PARALLEL or ASKEW, -1 otherwise
        See Also:
        computeDistance(Straight, Straight, Relationship), analyze(Straight, Straight, double), computeDistance(Straight, Straight, double)

        Parameters:

        b - another straight
        Returns:
        the point they share

      • computeIntersection

                                        Straight straight)
        for a straight INTERSECTING the plate this method computes the point that is on both the straight and the plate
        Parameters:
        plate - the plate intersected by the straight
        straight - the straight intersecting the plate
        Returns:
        the point they share

        Parameters:

      • findCorrespond

        public static GeometricObject findCorrespond(Renderable r)
        for a given renderable that is instance either of the following the result will be the geometric object that contains the renderable as a subset of points
        • Pixel to Point
        • Line to Straight
        • Triangle or Rectangle to Plate
        Parameters:
        r - a renderable that can be mapped to a geometric object
        Returns:
        the geometric object as explained above
